contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "the world" consists of both supernatural ("angels") and natural ("human beings") or 2) the list consists of three items: "to the world, to angels, and to human beings." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: to the worldâ€”to angels, and to human beings

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) this is a merism for all homosexual activity or 2) Paul is naming two different activities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: male prostitutes, those who practice homosexuality
